name: vscode-eslint
description: Integrates ESLint JavaScript into VS Code.
author: Microsoft Corporation

eslint.enable.description: Controls whether eslint is enabled or not.
eslint.enable.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated. Disable ESLint using the extensions viewlet.

eslint.packageManager.description: The package manager you use to install node modules.

eslint.alwaysShowStatus.description: Always show the ESlint status bar item.

eslint.nodeEnv.description: The value of NODE_ENV to use when running eslint tasks.

eslint.nodePath.description: A path added to NODE_PATH when resolving the eslint module.

eslint.options.description: The eslint options object to provide args normally passed to eslint when executed from a command line (see http://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/nodejs-api#cliengine).

eslint.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VSCode and the eslint linter service.

eslint.run.description: Run the linter on save (onSave) or on type (onType)

eslint.autoFixOnSave.description: Turns auto fix on save on or off.
eslint.autoFixOnSave.deprecationMessage: The setting is deprecated. Use editor.codeActionsOnSave instead with a source.fixAll.eslint member.

eslint.quiet.description: Turns on quiet mode, which ignores warnings.

eslint.onIgnoredFiles.description: Whether ESLint should issue a warning on ignored files.

eslint.migration.2_x.description: Whether ESlint should migrate auto fix on save settings.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path starts with this directory.

changeProcessCWD.description: Whether the process's cwd should be changed as well.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path starts with this directory.

!cwd.description: Set to true if ESLint shouldn't change the working directory.

pattern.description: A glob pattern to match a working directory.

!cwd.description: Set to true if ESLint shouldn't change the working directory.

language.description: The language id to be validated by ESLint.

autoFix.description: Whether auto fixes are provided for the language.

anyOf.deprecationMessage: Auto Fix is enabled by default. Use the single string form.

eslint.validate.description: An array of language ids which should be validated by ESLint. If not installed ESLint will show an error.

eslint.probe.description: An array of language ids for which the extension should probe if support is installed.

eslint.provideLintTask.deprecationMessage: This option is deprecated. Use eslint.lintTask.enable instead.
eslint.provideLintTask.description: Controls whether a task for linting the whole workspace will be available.

eslint.lintTask.enable.description: Controls whether a task for linting the whole workspace will be available.

eslint.lintTask.options.description: Command line options applied when running the task for linting the whole workspace (see https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/command-line-interface).

eslint.runtime.description: The location of the node binary to run ESLint under.

eslint.debug.description: Enables ESLint debug mode (same as --debug on the command line)

location.description: Configure the disable rule code action to insert the comment on the same line or a new line.

enumDescriptions: Fixes all possible problems in the file. This option might take some time.
Only fixes reported problems that have non overlapping textual edits. This options runs a lot faster.
eslint.codeActionsOnSave.mode.description: Specifies the code action mode. Possible values are 'all' and 'problems'.

scripts.webpack: npm run clean && webpack --mode production --config ./client/webpack.config.js && webpack --mode production --config ./server/webpack.config.js
scripts.webpack:dev: npm run clean && webpack --mode none --config ./client/webpack.config.js && webpack --mode none --config ./server/webpack.config.js
scripts.lint: npm run lint:client && npm run lint:server
scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ..
